list.name: Default
list.comment:
next steps:
what other domain specific knowledge than the "17% lower reservation price of the other agent" like in the paper? integrate more data for testing (whole year?) develop live update of the history (already current negotiation is considered in the next timestamp)
check counting of iteration... it does not work
make the ppc gen so that the constraints are not fixed but they regulate on their own... through OPF socket/files problem -> translation into working NS in the loop... translate to pypsa?
make a mmemory database and export to matlab to test some learning!
situation when deficit agent receives PC with too little resources -> it should break the simulation and propose better price (up to dso intervention price)
situation when deficit agent refuses already accepted bid offer (because it got a new price curve from another excess agent (e.g. modified one))
update 15minutes files to 5minutes ones. Put more data into code, import using the new script
visualisation, more testing of different cases, more files implementation - see below
Implement modifying the resources from files. Check files from Gianlu, David, Jannik, Andrea
~~~ extract the feasible excess as the price curve for further evaluation !!!!!! important to develop such scenario!!
normal negotiation: - build other blocks from the chart - develop the iterations > 1, in different moments, - integrate batteries - where in the details of the negotiation (opfs/decisions/evaluation/alignments), some ML might me used: + initial requests by Defs + initial price curves by Exc + alignment of the accept-mod (need behaviour of Def as answer)
Pursue towards the pure ML derivation i.e. prediction of adjacent power balances to propose better negotiations? - with no agents, only pure ML on an isolated system case and opfs...
ML data and implementation, where, what: 1) basic table with simple time data and PC and bids, and ML estimation of success 2) estimation generator by generator, resource by resource in order to make a real opf output estimation.
